internationalizations.description:
I'm a security-focused technologist who started on the development side. Shipping small products and student-led projects taught me how to debug quickly, collaborate with designers, and build guardrails into the code I write. Those projects still delivered measurable wins: a redesign I tuned improved page performance by roughly 20%, an internal helper tool I prototyped cut ticket resolution time in half, and a client environment I helped monitor stayed above 99.5% uptime during a risky rollout. Each milestone reminded me how fragile systems can be and why I want to be the person finding the cracks before attackers do.
That mindset pushed me into formal training. The IBM Cybersecurity Professional certificate gave me a solid footing in vulnerability assessment, threat modeling, and incident response. Since then I've been deep in labs: grinding through PortSwigger Web Security Academy paths, recreating real breaches in my home lab, and documenting findings to sharpen my reporting voice.

Now I'm investing every spare hour into offensive security. I'm studying cloud-native tactics through the AWS Cloud Practitioner track, building lightweight tooling to speed up recon, and pairing with mentors on capture-the-flag events.
The goal is clear: earn my way onto a red team where I can blend the builder's empathy with an attacker's curiosity, helping companies see the real-world impact of their blind spots while keeping the narrative tight and trustworthy.
